definition: to recognize/to know/to admit
"speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to believe/to think/to consider/to feel
to know/to recognize/to be familiar with/to get acquainted with sb/knowledge/understanding/awareness/cognition
conscientious/earnest/serious/to take seriously/to take to heart
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
to confirm/to verify/confirmation
to maintain (that sth is true)/to determine (a fact)/determination (of an amount)/of the firm opinion/to believe firmly/to set one's mind on/to identify with
to approve/approval/acknowledgment/OK
to authenticate/to approve
to declare to be untrue/to deny
to undertake to purchase sth/to subscribe (to share issue)
to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
publicly known (to be)/accepted (as)
cognition/cognitive/understanding/perception/awareness/to be cognizant of/to recognize/to realize
to agree tacitly/tacit approval/default (setting)
to confess/confession

sentences.english: But Peter declared, "Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you."
sentences.chinese: 彼得说，我就是必须和你同死，也总不能不认你。

sentences.english: The magazine's stand is very hard to locate.
sentences.chinese: 这杂志的立场观点总是认人捉摸不定。

sentences.english: However, sometimes § The best solution is to recognize a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 然而，有些时候会氶认最好的解决方法就是离婚。

sentences.english: Most people would think that we have a good chance. I think we do.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人都认我们有很大的几率晋级，我也这么认为。

sentences.english: I want him to identify him enemy Tong Pak Fu.
sentences.chinese: 让他当面认一下，他不共戴天的仇人唐伯虎。

sentences.english: Do you know anyone who punches a time clock?
sentences.chinese: 你认不认识曾经按过这种计时钟的人呢？

sentences.english: An aggressive man must be a go-getter.
sentences.chinese: 一个有进取心的认一定是个积极能干的人。

sentences.english: Even if they did wrong they will feel that they were right.
sentences.chinese: 就算做错了也不肯认，总是认为自己才是对的。

sentences.english: One's work is swept away when one becomes identified.
sentences.chinese: 一个人变得认同时，他的工作便一扫而空。

sentences.english: I have never for one instant seen clearly within myself. How then would you have me judge the deeds of others?
sentences.chinese: 我从没有片刻认清楚过自己，又怎能判断别人的言行？

sentences.english: Han Jia, I don't think oracle-bone inscriptions are difficult to read at all.
sentences.chinese: 韩佳，我发现这甲骨文一点也不难认。

sentences.english: I may not evermore acknowledge thee.
sentences.chinese: 我再也不会高声认你做知己。

sentences.english: Leaf's English, you still don't want to recognize me?
sentences.chinese: 叶英，你难道还不想认我？

sentences.english: I can't read the Chinese characters and I am confused!
sentences.chinese: 我不会认中国字，这把我搞糊涂了。

sentences.english: Ceng Yin advised him to recognize the home money woman as mother.
sentences.chinese: 曾音就建议他去认敬老院的钱太婆为娘。

sentences.english: Her parents, who are on holiday in Portugal, are said to have disowned her.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮的父母此刻在葡萄牙过假日，听说都不想认她了。

definition: to recognize people (of babies)/to be able to tell people apart
really/in fact/genuinely/scrupulously
adoptive father (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
to admit an error/to acknowledge one's mistake
to own up to a fault/to admit the truth/to acknowledge a debt
to regard as/to view/to consider sth as/to treat as
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
to count numbers/to keep to one's word/to hold (i.e. to remain valid)/to count (i.e. to be important)
to know each other/to recognize/to identify/to acknowledge (an old relationship)
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
one's own (child) (i.e. one's child by birth)/biological (parents)/birth (parents)
to know
to tell lies
to know/to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1 dao5]
genuine and sincere (idiom)/wholehearted
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
